title: Why dont people look up how to counter a champ before posting on boards???
body: It would make you look like less of a bronze 5 yasuo main

replies.body: ahh so now a post assuming rank is equal to a person's intelligence

If you want to be truthful, when it comes to a game that involves rank, it is fair to say rank is = to a person's intelligence on said game.

To assume a person who is bronze has the same game knowledge as someone in masters or so is crazy as it is.


Otherwise the lower rank would end up higher rank

yet the person who makes the post is silver 

and intelligence dont necessarily equate to skill.

lets take pro sports for example , football... the smartest players arent always the best player in terms of talent. 
for example: jason garrett ( current head coach of dallas cowboys graduated from princeton ) was back up to troy aikman where troy aikman was by far a more gifted and talented player ( is in hall of fame) 

jason garrett couldnt compete and achieve the same things aikman did as a player due to lack of skill not intelligence

You're using a completely different argument than what you want to say friend.

You can't use physical conditioning combined details when it comes to game knowledge.

Your argument could only be valid if you went by coach vs coach.

On this game knowledge does = skill.   the only way your argument would even be considerable is if one of the people has a physical disability in one of their hands that causes a delay.


A better comparison for you would have been the superbowl 49ers vs ravens the harbaugh bowl.

no i used two profootball players

jason garret was a pro nfl qb actually backed up troy aikman

know wtf u are talking about before you dismiss my comment

You don't know what you're talking about.

Because what i stated was Jason Garret didn't have half the physical ability aikman had.

You're trying to use a physical and mental argument for a mental argument only.


So your comment is still dismissed.

i said garrent is smarter then aikman while aikman was a better talent... 

had more skill 

that was in my actual comment comparing them as players

saying that is why garrent didnt achieve as a player what aikman did 

sorry that was too hard for you to follow

I'll say this in a way you can understand since it seems too hard for you to understand why using that argument is invalid.


PhysICal ABIliTIes AloNg wiTH MenTAl AbiLiTieS DOnT wOrk with MEntAl oNLy GaME

I understand you want to defend yourself to the death, but you're not helping youself.

Mental vs Mental is what you're looking for not physical and mental vs mental.

right so if physical ability has nothing to do with mental 

then saying you have less mental understand of a game cuz you arent high rank is wrong. 

cuz mental ability dont equal physical ability. and when it comes to this game there still is physical ability  that has to happen in order to be at the higest of elos 

so someone who is silver can have a great mental understanding of the game but physically not able to perform at a diamond level

If you actually think you need a decent level of physical abillity to play this game, then my examples to prove you wrong are well known targets.

1. Scarra
2.Voyboy
3.Imaqtpie
4. SKT T1 Wolf (cause he's even admitted he doesn't do anything but play games)


^all of them are very lazy and barely do much but play league or whatever game they feel like playing and keep a constant Challenger level play because They have a Mental understanding of the game, which is why they aren't bronze.


I'll toss in a bonus name : PinkWard

yes ... reaction time, dexterity , hand eye coordination 

physical abilities but they arent horrible with physical ability just not top tier ... they were above average physical skills and great mental understanding. 

and yet scarra , voyboy and imaqtpie wouldnt be as successful in the pro scene now then when they played. the over all talent has scaled higher and higher ... 

just like when Reginald was mid lane for tsm... he can not compete on the pro/lcs level any more barely did it then

None of them were above average physical skill, they were extremely out of shape with voyboy being your closest to being in shape.

And between now and then he had stopped playing for awhile, got less inactive, became more obese, but stays challenger because of his understanding of the game.
PantsAreDragon is senpai
PantsAreSenpai
This is true but you gotta condition even easy champs with little mechanics to teamfights and then that goes back to game knowledge which silver lack and thats why they arent challenger
so you are silver cuz you know nothing about the game ?

I know less than diamond players but i also dont play ranked. op.gg me and see how my norm and ranked winrates place me at higher elo, i just dont play. what you dont see is the deaths in ranked are results of me expecting team to engage for easy kills then running away its quite fun when the yasuo disconnected for 5 mins but you still win cuz you stomped your laner.

Not really, it's a knowledge vs skill argument.

Players can know a lot about the game and not have the skill to climb. Some players haven't climbed because they just don't play ranked. You can't assume a player is an idiot just because they have low rank. Doing so ignores significant factors.
oh and jim harbaugh was a pro nfl QB too before he coached in the NFL john harbaugh never did play in the nfl

Once again the point goes way above your head because you don't have a clue. Read the other comment, and just edit instead of needing to double post cause i'm not gonna backtrack cause you're struggling.
I dont play ranked i only have 12 rakned this season ill 1v1 you

1 vs 1 dont mean shit ... its not mortal kombat 

1 vs 1 me on what champ ? 

mirror match ? 

or non mirror match? 

you wanna take zed and ill take sona and you win cuz we have different champs? 

not all champs scale the same , i could go panth a shit on you in levels 1-3 but in extended 1 vs 1 you as yasou would out scale 

so this who ill 1 vs 1 is stupid. 

and you cant go around bitching about people's rank and intelligence when you "only played 12 ranked games" and then say any one of low elo or ranks are dumb acting as if you are superior
Doesnt matter pick your best champ ill pick mine. The fact that you dont want to tells me I already win
You also havent played a game in months so Im 100% confident i can beat on a champ i have never even played before

lol havent play a game in months on what account ? 

i have 4 

and if my best champ is sona and your best champ is vayne or who ever you winning the one vs one as me as sona and you as vayne dont prove you are a better player
I am entirely certain lich bane sona can kill vayne 1 v 1 with a good player

well lets see i have to be able to use mana and an ability to proc the sheen passive from lich bane and then auto , 

vayne just right clicks ... 

yes total win for sona... 

oh but i did play ap sona into nasus and won lane and game vs him 

i made an akali afk, and made a diana rage quit will being crit on hit sona
have fun with my bans ?
4 accounts and using a lvl 17 to rage spam a chat... well 2 +2 = 4
then why comment on the lvl 17? in fact why make more than 2?

none of them are banned 

but nice assumption
In fact an AD fiddlesticks can beat a scrub. Its not difficult if you know how to play the game

> [{quoted}](name=Paladin 0f Life,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEqN1p5x,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2017-10-09T16:03:26.246+0000)
>
> I dont play ranked i only have 12 rakned this season ill 1v1 you

"Rakaned"

Getting high rank takes hundreds of ranked games. F that. I'll take my 40-ish games, gold 5 0 lp and end of year rewards and have fun with normals and ARAM.

Don't assume everyone is hardstuck at whatever rank they are at.

Not exactly. Lots of people have plenty of knowledge but don't play ranked consistently, and thus don't climb.

I know several people like this, capable of playing on-par with higher tiers of play but don't play ranked.

you can't just assume that a person who is low rank is unintelligent. There are a lot of other factors that play into a person being low rank.

> [{quoted}](name=HalcyonDweller,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEqN1p5x,comment-id=000000000002,timestamp=2017-10-09T18:25:50.409+0000)
>
> Not exactly. Lots of people have plenty of knowledge but don't play ranked consistently, and thus don't climb.
> 
> I know several people like this, capable of playing on-par with higher tiers of play but don't play ranked.
> 
> you can't just assume that a person who is low rank is unintelligent. There are a lot of other factors that play into a person being low rank.

I think it's only really apply able if they have a decent amount of games,  let's say you're silver and have 300 games or even just 100,  you probably are at the place your skill level puts you at. You could have quite a lot and a decent amount of game knowledge (won't match a challenger/master player or whatever) but not grind or play a lot of ranked. 

I feel like your rank says a lot about your knowledge if you've played a decent amount of games but doesn't reflect all you know. 

I don't think it's realistic to tell a silver 3 player they don't know what they're talking about  because they're silver. That's just being a dick instead of opening a discussion imo.
Thanks, I couldn't agree more.
Idk man, Ive seen/heard of some pretty high ranking people with thoughts of a fresh level 30 bronze.

something something im perfect, something something i deserve challenger, something something poorly built game i could design better, something something it's my teams fault.


Did i cover it all?
Boards in a nutshell
Chillax, people. He's not calling someone bronze as an insult, per se, but rather using the ancient stereotype of Yasuo mains, in that they automatically call anyone they lose to "broken".
This is hilarious and all this is just driving my point home. Just. WOW

> [{quoted}](name=Paladin 0f Life,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEqN1p5x,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-10-09T17:43:11.588+0000)
>
> This is hilarious and all this is just driving my point home. Just. WOW

Not necessarily. Some of them are complaining about you bursting their bubble, some are assuming that you're rank-shaming, and some are a bit annoyed at your very...tactless way of speech.
Internet culture in a nutshell. It's easier to find fault in everything and cast the blame elsewhere without looking to one's self first.

Every time that I HAVE asked people on boards "what are some tips against {{champion:122}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:5}} AND {{champion:126}}"  I am met with 1-2 comments that are obvious such as "build Armor/Mr first" and toxic comments.

So I'd rather not do the same thing and expect a different result.

EDIT: I forgot to state that I also make sure to include, when I ask for tips, that I am a {{champion:83}} main

I can help you with heim, xin nad trundle if you need it. I have no problem when you ask like this. The problem is people being like, gg garen op. how do i play against a garen he is too strong. When in reality all you have to do is kite him and bait his q then make sure you stay away if you have his ult on you
I can help you with heim, xin nad trundle if you need it

I'll be honest, most of these champs I asked about over 1+ month ago.

Still having problems with {{champion:67}} {{champion:85}} and {{champion:126}}.

other than those three I go even in lane.
